repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: OutRight is a Triangle-area organization that was founded in 1990 and is now disbanded. OutRight provided support for gay youth and other young people with questions about their sexual orientation. The OutRight records consist of meeting minutes, correspondence, financial records, resources and programs (including clippings, flyers, and pamphlets), and literature on AIDS and sexuality. The materials also include reports on nationwide trends and LGBTQ issues.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection contains sensitive information. Contact Research Services for Access: https://duke.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8fblaT2NbgbQujj

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], OutRight Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The OutRight Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1997-2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection reprocessed and collection guide updated by Amelia Verkerk, November 2019

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: OutRight was a Triangle-area organization founded in 1990 and now disbanded. OutRight provided support for gay youth and other young people with questions about their sexual orientation.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The OutRight Records chiefly consist of minutes from meetings, correspondence, financial records, publicity (including clippings, flyers, and pamphlets), and literature on AIDS and sexuality. Also included are reports on nationwide trends and LGBTQ issues, the organization's by-laws, fundraising, correspondence, program planning, and administrative information.

controlaccess.corpname: Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative Materials relate mostly to office files, such as by-laws and policies for the organization, fundraising, events, grant opportunities and applications, and general donation information. Materials are arranged chronologically by year and alphabetically within each year.

did.unittitle: Ground rules for Outright youth meetings
Policies for adults working with youth
Receipts for conferences, programs, and resources
Outright by-laws, position descriptions, and applications
By-laws, organization info, letters, and referrals
Invoices, brochures, and other youth services

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Minutes include the minutes of program committee meetings and retreat meetings. Materials are arranged chronologically by year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Programs and resources include pamphlets, flyers, and literature of other LGBTQ youth groups, articles written about the OutRight organization and about LGBTQ communities, and national reports about violence against the LGBTQ communities. Materials also include OutRight's programs, such as the hotline call logs, flyers, resource lists, and local events. Materials are arranged chronologically by year and alphabetically within each year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes letters between staff members, about National Coming Out Day, youth programs, and donations and contributions. Materials are arranged chronologically by year and alphabetically within each year.

did.unittitle: Contribution letter from Lee and Wells

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volunteering and board members materials relate mostly to information about OutRight staff and volunteers, such as volunteering opportunities, training packets, list of volunteers and board members, and applications. Materials are arranged chronologically by year and alphabetically within each year.
